title: Tejas fighter jet crashes in Dubai during air show; IAF confirms pilot dead
content: Tragedy struck the Dubai Air Show as an Indian Air Force Tejas fighter jet crashed during an aerobatic display, resulting in the pilot's fatal injuries. The HAL-built aircraft nosedived, causing a massive fireball and panic among spectators. Emergency teams responded swiftly to the incident. The IAF expressed deep regret over the loss of life.

title: Why the Internet keeps going down every few weeks
content: The internet experiences major outages every few weeks due to increasing centralisation—AWS, Google Cloud, and Azure now power most online services, creating single points of failure. Technical issues like DNS problems, configuration errors, and automation failures cascade across interconnected systems. Despite redundancy efforts, these outages disrupt emergency services, banking, and transportation.The decentralised internet envisioned for resilience has become a fragile network dependent on a few massive providers.

title: Mega shift in Bihar cabinet: CM Nitish gives home portfolio to BJP; who got what
content: Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar has finalized his expanded cabinet, assigning portfolios after his tenth swearing-in. The BJP, as the largest party, received key ministries including Home, Land and Revenue, and Health. Smaller allies like LJP(R), HAM, and RLM have also been allocated significant departments, following a grand ceremony attended by national leaders.

title: ‘Rumour and speculation’: Intel CEO shuts down TSMC theft claims; Taiwan flags security risk
content: Intel CEO Lip-Bu Tan has denied allegations that a recently hired executive brought proprietary information from TSMC, stating the company respects intellectual property. This comes as Taiwan's High Prosecutors Office and TSMC launch investigations into whether trade secrets were removed without authorization. The controversy centers on Lo Wen-jen, a veteran executive who recently moved from TSMC to Intel.

title: Race for rare earths: US, Russia look beyond China – here's what's drawing focus
content: A global race is on to secure Arctic resources, particularly rare earths, as nations seek alternatives to China's dominance. Melting ice is unlocking Greenland's mineral wealth, attracting significant investment and sparking discoveries of crucial metals for electronics and defense. Sweden is also developing its own substantial rare earth deposits, though challenges in remote Arctic mining remain.

title: Bangladesh’s comical fielding gifts India Super Over at Asia Cup Rising Stars - Watch
content: In a dramatic turn of events, India forced a Super Over after Bangladesh fumbled a seemingly easy win. A critical run-out error by the wicketkeeper on the final ball of India's innings allowed them to tie the score. The subsequent Super Over saw India collapse, losing both wickets for zero runs, capping a chaotic finish.

title: Asia Cup Rising Stars | India all out for 0: How Super Over drama unfolded
content: In a stunning Asia Cup Rising Stars semifinal, Bangladesh A defeated India A in a dramatic Super Over. After both teams tied at 194, India A collapsed to 0/2 in the Super Over. Bangladesh A, needing just one run, secured victory on a wide ball after a missed stumping, ending a truly unforgettable contest.

title: 'Don't be robotic, focus on human skills': Rishi Sunak's advice to AI era job seekers
content: Former UK PM Rishi Sunak advises young professionals to blend AI proficiency with essential human skills. He stresses that while managing AI agents will be common, critical thinking, reasoning, and empathy remain paramount.  This hybrid approach, supported by economic data, is crucial for navigating the evolving job market. Graduates must learn to collaborate with AI effectively.

title: Crackdown on terror: J&K cops bust hideout; rifles, grenades seized
content: Security forces in Jammu and Kashmir's Kupwara district have thwarted a potential terror plot by recovering a substantial cache of arms and ammunition from a hideout near the Line of Control. The haul included M4 assault rifles, Chinese pistols, hand grenades, and numerous live rounds, discovered during a search operation in the Neeriyan Forest area.

title: Don’t wait for ‘right time’! How 5-yr delay in investment can cost you - explained
content: Procrastinating on investing due to fear of market timing is a common pitfall, costing individuals significant wealth over time. Professionals cannot reliably time the market, and waiting for perfection allows time to work against you. Starting, even small and simple, is crucial for long-term growth.

title: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella to employees: Must rapidly rethink AI; calls shift 'critical'
content: Google has launched Nano Banana Pro, an advanced AI image generator powered by Gemini 3. This upgrade offers superior reasoning, enhanced world knowledge, and precise text rendering. Users can now create higher-resolution images, control lighting and camera angles, and integrate real-time Google Search data, marking a significant leap for creative professionals.

title: Inside Smriti Mandhana-Palash Muchhal’s haldi ceremony
content: Indian cricket star Smriti Mandhana and composer-filmmaker Palash Muchhal's wedding festivities have begun with vibrant Haldi celebrations.  Smriti's teammates joined the joyous occasion, dancing with the bride.  Earlier, Palash shared a touching proposal video from DY Patil Stadium. With the wedding set for November 23, 2025, excitement is palpable for the couple.

title: Bigg Boss 19: Malti Chahar's brother and cricketer Deepak Chahar enters the show
content: During family week on Bigg Boss 19, contestant Malti Chahar was thrilled when her brother, cricketer Deepak Chahar, made a surprise visit. In a delightful promo, Deepak playfully wakes Malti from her slumber, making light-hearted jokes about her culinary skills while requesting a homemade feast. His unexpected arrival lifted Malti's spirits, providing a cheerful distraction from her feelings of homesickness.

title: 'All 140 MLAs are mine': DK Shivakumar on Karnataka CM post; Siddaramaiah responds
content: Karnataka Deputy Chief Minister DK Shivakumar asserted that all 140 MLAs are his, dismissing speculation about groupism amid cabinet reshuffle talks. Chief Minister Siddaramaiah clarified that cabinet decisions rest with the high command, stating he will present the next budget and continue his term. Shivakumar also reassured party workers about his continued leadership role.

title: Savannah James gets emotional as daughter Zhuri joins new SZN Volleyball team
content: Savannah James celebrated her daughter Zhuri Nova's milestone as she begins her volleyball journey with the popular SZN team. Despite her family's basketball background, Zhuri Nova chose a different athletic path. The proud mother shared heartwarming clips and reflected on Zhuri Nova's 11th birthday, highlighting her daughter's intelligence and confidence.

title: LiAngelo ball goes platinum with breakout hit “Tweaker” featuring Drake
content: LiAngelo Ball, formerly a basketball player, has achieved a major milestone in music. His debut single 'Tweaker' has gone platinum. This success signifies a significant crossover from sports to the entertainment industry. The song became a cultural phenomenon, embraced by sports teams and charting highly. Ball's journey redefines his public identity and highlights his artistic ambition.

title: Stephen Curry’s wife earns major nomination at 2025 Glossy Beauty Awards
content: Ayesha Curry's beauty brand, Sweet July Skin, has earned a nomination for Best Category Launch at the 2025 Glossy Beauty and Wellness Awards for its successful Lip Treatment. This recognition follows previous accolades for the brand, highlighting its growing impact in the beauty industry. The winners will be revealed on December 2, 2025.

title: Toxic air chokes playgrounds: Delhi schools halt outdoor sports amid high AQI
content: The Directorate of Education (DoE) has suspended all outdoor sports activities in Delhi schools as air quality worsens, following concerns raised by the Supreme Court (SC) and directions from the Commission for Air Quality Management (CAQM). With AQI levels reaching the ‘severe’ category in several localities, including a high of 442 in Wazirpur, schools have cancelled sports schedules and shifted to indoor plans. Meanwhile, the Delhi government announced long-term school modernisation with AI-enabled tools and upgraded infrastructure.

title: Aaron Rodgers injury update: Steelers QB likely to return vs Bears this week
content: Steelers quarterback Aaron Rodgers' wrist injury update offers hope for Week 12 against the Bears. Despite a distal radius fracture, Rodgers participated in limited practice, taking shotgun snaps to protect his wrist. His availability hinges on medical clearance and coach Tomlin's assessment of safety, with backup Mason Rudolph ready if needed.

title: Asia Cup Rising Stars | 250+ SR: How Sooryavanshi fared in semi-final
content: Vaibhav Sooryavanshi's electrifying 15-ball 38, featuring four sixes, ignited India A's pursuit of 195 in the Asia Cup Rising Stars semifinal. His aggressive start, coupled with a 53-run opening stand, propelled the team to a strong position. Despite a brief slowdown after his dismissal, India A remains in a commanding chase.

title: India's 'musical-chair' story: Gambhir & No.3 conundrum - 7 batters in 18 Tests
content: India's Test struggles at home are amplified by the constant shuffling at the No.3 batting position. Under coach Gautam Gambhir, seven different batters have occupied this crucial slot in just 18 Tests, raising concerns about stability and planning. This instability at one-down has become a focal point as Team India seeks to regain balance in their red-ball setup.

title: Viral post highlights emotional toll of sudden job loss— 7 research-backed ways to cope
content: As the shock of sudden layoffs reverberates through the workforce, many are left feeling deceived and vulnerable following reassurances of job security. Studies reveal that these abrupt decisions can heighten stress and disrupt the fundamental trust that forms the employer-employee relationship. Professionals recommend recognizing these sentiments and embracing constructive strategies to ease the transition and foster thoughtful decision-making.

title: 'Bomb-making' machine in Faridabad: How Dr Muzammil improvised his explosive setup; first pics out
content: A flour mill in Faridabad was converted into a chemical workshop by a terror suspect. This suspect, Muzammil, was involved in the Delhi car blast. Investigators found evidence of meticulous planning for over two years. Nearly 3,000kg of explosives and arms were discovered. The network is being dismantled to prevent further attacks.

title: 4 Labour Codes made effective to simplify and streamline labour laws - check top details
content: India's government has announced the implementation of four consolidated labor codes, effective November 21, 2025, to modernize regulations and strengthen worker protections. This significant policy shift rationalizes 29 existing laws, aiming to create a future-ready labor ecosystem that promotes formalization, ensures timely wages, and expands social security for all workers.

title: IND vs SA: 'Someone who gives that freedom' - Pant on 'real goal'
content: Rishabh Pant takes charge of India's Test side against South Africa in Guwahati, stepping in for Shubman Gill.  Pant, making his Test captaincy debut at a venue dear to him, discussed team balance and his leadership philosophy of fostering player freedom. He anticipates a good batting wicket in Guwahati, with spin expected later.

title: Taylor Swift moves on with Travis Kelce, refuses Joe Alwyn’s plea for closure
content: Nearly two years after their breakup, reports resurfaced detailing Joe Alwyn's desire for a final conversation with Taylor Swift to find closure. However, Swift had already processed her emotions through music and moved on, finding healing and new love with Travis Kelce. Her friends supported her decision to avoid revisiting the past, prioritizing her current stability and future.

title: 89 and falling: Rupee hits record low; biggest drop since July amid weak equity cues
content: The Indian rupee experienced its sharpest single-day decline in over three months on Friday, falling past the 89-per-dollar mark for the first time. This significant drop occurred amidst a weak sentiment in both domestic and global equity markets. The currency's fall was influenced by global cues and a flat growth in the country's core infrastructure sectors.

title: Trump sanctions take effect today: Will India stop buying Russian crude oil? Yes — and no.
content: US sanctions on Russia's Rosneft and Lukoil, effective November 21, 2025, are impacting India's oil imports. Russian crude loadings for India have significantly dropped, forcing refiners to seek alternative sources. While direct procurement from sanctioned entities will cease, Russia's oil may continue to flow through less transparent channels, impacting global trade dynamics.

title: ‘Life-threatening situation’: 10 reasons why Delhi is in a pollution health emergency
content: Delhi's air quality has plunged into a life-threatening emergency, exceeding 'severe' levels due to open fires, vehicles, and garbage burning, not just stubble. Hospitals are overwhelmed, schools are disrupted, and citizen protests highlight systemic failures. Experts urge region-wide emission controls and waste management fixes to prevent a year-round health catastrophe.

title: Fact vs fiction: Why did Gill fly from Kolkata to Guwahati despite the injury?
content: Shubman Gill's travel to Guwahati for the second Test against South Africa was a calculated risk, with management hoping for a last-minute recovery. Despite no red flags from the BCCI medical team, Gill was deemed not to be match-fit, leading to his eventual withdrawal and travel to Mumbai for specialist consultation.

title: Bihar: Kishor outlines plan after poll rout; urges people to donate to Jan Suraaj
content: Jan Suraaj founder Prashant Kishor pledged to donate 90% of his income for the next five years to fund his party's campaign after its debut Bihar assembly election failure. He also criticised the Nitish Kumar cabinet as corrupt and accused the ruling alliance of vote-buying through cash transfers, vowing to ensure women receive promised funds.

title: First time in 116 years! Day 1 of AUS vs ENG scripts cricketing history
content: A dramatic Ashes opening day saw 19 wickets tumble, with England's bowlers seizing the initiative. Mitchell Starc's seven-wicket haul initially put England in trouble, but Ben Stokes' exceptional five-wicket haul then decimated Australia. Despite batting first, England fought back strongly to end the day with a lead, setting up a thrilling contest.

title: Trump tariff impact: CBO trims deficit-cut estimate by $1trillion
content: The Congressional Budget Office has revised its deficit reduction forecast for President Trump's tariffs, now projecting $3 trillion over a decade, down from $4 trillion. This adjustment stems from updated data and recent tariff changes. While critics argue consumers bear tariff costs, the White House maintains foreign exporters pay, generating significant revenue.

title: '7km long, 25m deep': Israel reveals one of Gaza's 'largest & most complex' tunnels - video
content: The IDF revealed a vast Hamas tunnel network in southern Gaza, reportedly used to hold the body of soldier Hadar Goldin. This complex, stretching over seven kilometers and featuring numerous rooms, ran beneath civilian areas. Hamas returned Goldin's remains after 11 years, following his abduction during the 2014 Gaza War.

title: Not saved enough for retirement? Top 5 things to do - here’s how to catch up
content: Retiring comfortably after starting late is achievable. Prioritize boosting savings significantly, even if it means trimming lifestyle expenses. Avoid high-risk investments; instead, focus on disciplined saving and a modest equity allocation. Consider extending your working years or exploring a reverse mortgage if your nest egg remains insufficient. These strategies can help secure your desired retirement.

title: 'Varanasi' controversy: Ram Gopal Varma defends SS Rajamouli amid atheism row
content: Filmmaker Ram Gopal Varma has publicly defended SS Rajamouli after the director faced backlash for declaring himself an atheist. Varma argued that atheism is constitutionally protected and that an artist's personal beliefs shouldn't limit their creative expression. He suggested critics' jealousy fuels the controversy, asserting Rajamouli's success will continue regardless.

title: Sebi chairman TK Pandey rejects fresh framework on digital gold - here's what he said
content: Sebi chairman Tuhin Kanta Pandey clarified that the regulator is not developing new frameworks for digital gold, emphasizing that only existing, regulated options like gold ETFs and tradable gold securities are under its purview.  He also discussed Sebi's efforts to enhance the market for REITs and InvITs, including their classification for mutual funds.

title: Video: Palash Muchhal proposes to Smriti Mandhana
content: Cricketer Smriti Mandhana and composer Palash Muchhal are set to marry on November 23rd. Muchhal's heartwarming proposal video at DY Patil Stadium, where India won the Women's World Cup, has gone viral. Mandhana playfully confirmed their engagement with teammates. Prime Minister Modi also sent heartfelt wishes, noting their union as a blend of accomplished journeys.

title: Emergency captaincy! Pant drops truth bomb — 'Not the best scenario'
content: Rishabh Pant will captain India in the second Test against South Africa after Shubman Gill's injury. Acknowledging the unusual circumstances, Pant expressed gratitude for the opportunity and emphasized focusing on winning the crucial match. He confirmed Gill's replacement is decided, praising the injured skipper's resilience. Pant aims for a balanced approach, blending conventional and innovative strategies for victory.

title: 'Teacher said he did it intentionally': Father of student who died by suicide in Delhi
content: The suicide note, recovered from the student's school bag, read, "I am very sorry I did this, but the school staff said so much that I had to do it. If any of my body (organs) works or is in condition to work, please donate it to someone who really needs it. My parents did a lot; I am sorry I couldn't give them anything. I'm sorry, brother, I was rude. I'm sorry, mother, I broke your heart so many times, now I will break it for the last time."

title: Explained: Negative G Manoeuvre That Tejas Pilot Performed Before Crash
content: An LCA Tejas fighter jet that crashed during an air show in Dubai was executing a negative G turn before it slammed the ground, aviation experts who saw visuals of the manoeuvre have said based on their initial assessment.

title: PM Modi Arrives In Johannesburg To Attend G20 Summit
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi arrived in Johannesburg on Friday to attend the G20 Leaders' Summit being held under South Africa's Presidency. Modi arrived at Waterkloof Air Force Base (AFB) in Gauteng, where he was accorded a traditional welcome.

title: Gautam Adani Calls For India's Civilisational Strength To Guide Its Future Amid AI Shift
content: Adani Group Chairman Gautam Adani on Friday said that India's civilisational strength lies in its ability to learn, rebuild and move forward, describing the country's progress as a reflection of its enduring identity.

title: Families Protest Outside Delhi School After Student's Suicide, Demand Strict Action
content: Families and friends of a Class 10 student who died by suicide staged a protest outside St Columba's School, accusing some teachers of mentally harassing him and demanding strict action from the authorities.

title: Pak Ex-Cricketer Danish Kaneria Praises Gautam Adani's Commitment To Preserving Culture, Knowledge
content: Former Pakistani cricketer Danish Kaneria has expressed admiration for industrialist Gautam Adani, praising his efforts in preserving cultural heritage.

title: "At Air Shows, You Are Much Closer To Ground": Retired IAF Vice Chief On LCA Tejas Crash
content: Air Marshal Anil Chopra (retired) has explained to NDTV the likely immediate steps the authorities would take as they begin to investigate the crash of an LCA Tejas in an airshow in Dubai today.

title: After US Shutdown, Trump's 'Golden Dome Missile' Shield Plagued By Delays
content: President Donald Trump's Golden Dome missile defense initiative is facing significant delays, hampered by the 43-day government shutdown and lack of a clear plan to spend the first $25 billion appropriated for the programme this summer

title: Uddhav Thackeray Keen On Allying With Raj, Trying To Sway Congress: Sources
content: Shiv Sena (UBT) chief Uddhav Thackeray is keen on contesting the upcoming corporation elections in Mumbai in alliance with its Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA) allies and cousin Raj Thackeray's Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS), sources said.

title: Ex Temple Board President Arrested In Sabarimala Gold Heist Case
content: In a major setback to the Kerala government and the ruling Left Democratic Front, the Special Investigation Team probing the Sabarimala temple gold heist arrested former TDB president A Padmakumar in Kerala's Aranmula on

title: Pilot Dies As Tejas Fighter Jet Crashes, Bursts Into Flames At Dubai Air Show
content: A Tejas fighter jet crashed on Friday afternoon during a flying demonstration at the Dubai Air Show, sending a plume of thick black smoke over Al Maktoum International Airport as crowds looked on.

title: Medical Colleges To Get Guidelines To Crack Down On 'Anti-National' Activity
content: The National Medical Commission is preparing to circulate a fresh set of regulatory guidelines to medical institutions and practitioners across the country, directing them to "refrain from anti-national activities within workplaces".

title: Emergency Room Of Private Hospital Turns Wedding Venue In Kerala
content: In a rare incident, the emergency room of a private hospital turned into a wedding venue after a Thumboli native tied the knot with his bride, who had been injured in a road accident here on Friday, hospital authorities said.

title: Explained: How New Labour Codes Mark Transformative Step For Welfare Of Workers
content: The establishment of the new Labour Codes marks a transformative step in India's labour landscape -- one that balances the welfare of workers with the efficiency of enterprises, the government data showed on Friday.

title: After Dubai Air Show Tragedy, A Lookback At First-Ever Tejas Crash
content: An Indian Tejas fighter jet crashed at the Dubai air show today, marking only the second tragic incident involving the indigenous model in over 24 years since its first test flight in 2001.

title: 3 Methods White Collar Terror Module Architect Used To Find Candidates
content: Maulvi Irfan Ahmed, the arrested terror suspect from Jammu and Kashmir who put the Jaish-e-Mohammeds (JeM) plan to create a white collar terror module into motion, kept an eye on potential candidates who he could radicalise.

title: Madvi Hidma's Killing Has Broken Maoists' Backbone: Chhattisgarh Chief Minister
content: The elimination of top Maoist commander Madvi Hidma in an encounter earlier this week has broken the backbone of the rebels, Chhattisgarh Chief Minister Vishnu Deo Sai said on Friday.

title: When Chhattisgarh Leader Was 'Welcomed' With Maoist Firing For An Hour
content: Chhattisgarh Assembly Speaker Raman Singh had visited his Lok Sabha constituency. Suddenly, guns started roaring. There was chaos on the streets. For Singh, this was his first-hand experience of Maoist violence in his state.

title: Probe Agency ED Conducts Raids Across Bengal In Multi-Crore Coal Smuggling Scam
content: The Enforcement Directorate on Friday conducted simultaneous raids and search operations at several locations across West Bengal, including the state capital Kolkata, as part of a money laundering probe against the coal mafia.

title: Gujarat Poll Officer Dies By Suicide, Family Says He Blamed SIR Workload
content: A school teacher deployed to work as a Booth Level Officer (BLO) allegedly died by suicide in Gujarat's Gir Somnath district on Friday.

title: Bricks, Sticks Fly As Groups Clash During Kartik Puja In West Bengal
content: Tensions flared in West Bengal's Krishnanagar during the immersion of idols after Kartik Puja, with visuals showing vandalism at a government bus passenger shelter.

title: Partial relief to Revanna as Karnataka High Court quashes offence of outraging modesty against him but retains sexual harassment allegation
content: High Court has asked the special court to re-examine whether it is a fit case to take cognisance of the alleged office under Section 354A of the IPC by condoning the delay of more than three years

title: APMIDC GM arrested in disproportionate assets case
content: ACB officials unearth properties valued at ₹6 crore, allegedly disproportionate to her known source of income

title: Karnataka expert committee recommends continuing bike-taxi ban
content: The committee has stated that bike taxis violate the Motor Vehicles Act, pose safety risks to both riders and passengers, and can further burden Bengaluru’s already stressed transportation network

title: Naidu sets target of constructing 17 lakh houses in three years
content: Govt. has already completed over 3 lakh homes and the momentum should be carried forward to build a total of 20 lakh houses during its tenure, says Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu

title: Odisha Cabinet approves GCC policy intending to set up five GCC hubs in State
content: In wake of recent irregularities in recruitment of sub inspector of police, establishment of Odisha Uniformed Services Staff Selection Commission (OUSSSC) was approved for all uniformed services

title: Police to seek custody of Maoists arrested in Andhra Pradesh
content: Fifty Maoists arrested in various districts are currently in jail on being sent to 14-day judicial remand

title: CPI(M) accuses A.P. government of imposing ₹36,655 crore burden on power consumers
content: ₹15,485 crore has been collected as adjustment charges within 17 months, and preparations are on to levy an additional ₹12,771 crore for 2019–24 period, says Babu Rao

title: Govt. to introduce uniform security template for 250 seaports across the country
content: A ‘sovereign entity’ will take over security at private seaports too; in the initial period, 80 seaports that handle export and import of goods will be regulated by the CISF

title: Four of family found dead in well in Dharwad
content: The bodies of the four victims, including two children, were found in a well at Yallamma Devi Temple in Chikkamalligawad village

title: Investment fraud: attachment procedures initiated against eight suspected firms
content: The bank accounts of all the companies have been frozen with the support of lead bank authorities in the respective districts, following the District Collector’s order

title: Encroachments cleared from 29 parks in Nellore Rural Assembly constituency
content: Park sites spread over 18 acres secured with compound walls after MLA mobilises funds under the Chandranna Parkula Bata initiative.

title: Arms, ammunition, and fake currency seized in West Bengal’s Murshidabad
content: Arms seizure, fake currency, and arrests raise security concerns ahead of West Bengal Assembly elections

title: Assam organisations protest in Delhi for Bodo Accord implementation
content: The two-day ‘national movement’ also sought to pressure the Centre for the passage of the 125th Constitutional Amendment Bill

title: State govt. committed to expanding medical education, healthcare, says Minister
content: 22 medical colleges have already been established across the State in the last two-and-a-half years, while three more are in progress

title: CPI(M) hints that action against Padmakumar will hinge on Sabarimala case outcome
content: Govindan says the party will not shield those who have misplaced the trust the Left Democratic Front government pinned on them while entrusting them with key responsibilities

title: Nagapattinam MP seeks special trains for Nagore Dargah Kandoori festival
content: MP V. Selvaraj called on Southern Railway GM R.N. Singh in Chennai a few days ago and submitted a memorandum seeking special trains between Chennai and Karaikal via Nagore from November 21 to December 4

title: Delhi blast: Delhi HC refuses accused’s plea to meet lawyer at NIA HQs
content: The High Court said the accused was not a special person and that a certain process has to be followed in the court

title: Awareness campaign on PM Surya Ghar Muft Bijli Yojana intensified in Eluru district
content: 4,293 households in the district have installed rooftop solar panels, and 36 empanelled vendors are working to facilitate installations, says official

title: YSRCP leader Chevireddy Bhaskar Reddy denies links to liquor scam
content: In his submission to the court, the former MLA insists that real estate business has been his only source of income for nearly three decades

title: Andhra Pradesh High Court dismisses habeas corpus plea filed by kin of Maoists
content: It gives liberty to the petitioners to approach the court again if and when concrete evidence of alleged detention of Maoists by the police emerges

title: Watch: What is the Supreme court’s opinion in Presidential Reference? | Explained
content: After two months of hearings, the Supreme Court has issued a landmark advisory on whether timelines can be imposed on the President or Governors for State Bills. This explainer unpacks its views on “deemed assent”, judicial overreach, federalism, and the continuing relevance of the April 8 ruling.

title: Eluru officials told to educate students on drug abuse
content: Collector urges citizens to report drug use or peddling in educational institutions by dialling the toll-free number 1972

title: Texans' D thumps Bills, stakes claim as NFL's best
content: Against one of the NFL's top offenses, the Texans showed why they have the No. 1-ranked defense, sacking Josh Allen eight times and forcing three turnovers in a 23-19 win.

title: Lamb: Missed Vegas curfew prompted benching
content: Cowboys wide receiver CeeDee Lamb said he and George Pickens missed curfew Sunday, which resulted in both players missing the first series of Monday's game against the Raiders.

title: Lakers fire Buss brothers from scouting roles
content: The Lakers are reorganizing their basketball operations department and have terminated brothers Joey and Jesse Buss from their respective front office positions.

title: Sources: Players unmoved by WNBA's proposal
content: The WNBPA believes the league's latest CBA proposal misses the mark and does not include a system where the salary cap and player salaries sufficiently grow with the business, sources told ESPN.

title: Maxey has career-high 54 as 76ers outlast Bucks
content: Sixers guard Tyrese Maxey had a career-high 54 points and nine assists in a 123-114 overtime victory over the Bucks on Thursday.

title: Ovechkin's hat trick puts him 10th on points list
content: Alex Ovechkin had his 33rd career hat trick and added an assist to move into 10th place on the NHL points list, helping the Capitals beat Montreal 8-4 on Thursday night.

title: Darnold: Seattle's NFL-high 20 TO's 'unacceptable'
content: Seahawks quarterback Sam Darnold says he understands he and the team have to be better protecting the ball after a four-week stretch in which they've committed 12 turnovers, bringing their NFL-worst total to 20.

title: Las Vegas GP: Drain cover causes red flags again
content: The 2023 Las Vegas GP saw Carlos Sainz's Ferrari damaged by a loose drain cover, with the 2025 edition causing red flags in FP2.

title: 🏀 Men's CBB Power Rankings: Arizona is No. 1
content: The Wildcats added another statement win to their early-season résumé, headlining this week's top-25 risers.

title: NBA first-month lessons: What we're hearing on all 30 teams
content: Tim Bontemps takes the pulse of the league on OKC's chase for 70 wins, the potential post-Trae Hawks and more first-month standout storylines.

title: 36 games you need to follow during a hectic Week 13
content: A Big Ten showdown in the West, playoff hopefuls trying hang on and the potential to clear things up in the ACC.

title: Our guide to every Week 12 NFL game: Matchup previews, predictions, picks and nuggets
content: Another Eagles vs. Cowboys classic? McCaffrey vs. the Panthers? Picks, predictions and stats for every Week 12 game.

title: How Baker Mayfield's 'spark' came back after five games with the Rams
content: Although Los Angeles won just two of the five games with Mayfield, he "ignited" the building with the team.

title: The Polar Bear in Boston? A return to Queens? Potential free agent fits for Pete Alonso
content: For a second straight winter, the Mets' franchise home run king is seeking a long-term deal. Where might he land?

title: Should the Tigers trade Tarik Skubal? We asked around MLB
content: Will the best pitcher in baseball be on the move this offseason? Those in the game offer their advice.

title: Portal? Coaching carousel? North Texas' QB whisperer and his latest protégé aren't worried
content: Eric Morris has tutored QBs from Patrick Mahomes to Cam Ward and John Mateer. How he mentors them is key to their successes and his.

title: Early offseason needs for all 32 NFL teams: Positions to upgrade, draft prospects to watch, more
content: How can all 32 NFL teams improve during the offseason? We took an early look at positional needs, free agents to watch and intriguing draft fits.

title: What makes Sarah Strong so good? The seven traits she shares with former UConn stars
content: Stewie's dominance. Taurasi's confidence. Collier's efficiency. UConn's Sarah Strong has all that -- and more.

title: NHL Power Rankings: 1-32 poll, each team's quarter-season MVP
content: The Avalanche's reign atop the list continues, and the Blackhawks break into the top 10. Here's the full list.

title: Grading preseason bold predictions for all 32 NHL teams
content: Some of our wild takes from September don't look so wild anymore. Others are way off base. Here's an update.

title: Laurens' weekend preview: Derbies galore with Arsenal vs. Spurs, plus NWSL Championship
content: It's Friday and a full weekend of action awaits across the soccer calendar. So who better to tee up the best matches than Julien Laurens? In a new weekly feature, he picks out the best of the action ahead.

title: WNBA mock draft: There's a new No. 1 replacing Lauren Betts at the top
content: Four UCLA players, including Lauren Betts, are now projected first-round picks. But Spain's Awa Fam is No. 1.

title: Players to watch at reborn SEC volleyball tournament
content: Torrey Stafford at Texas, Brooklyn DeLeye at Kentucky and Ifenna Cos-Okpalla at Texas A&M prepare to step into the spotlight of an SEC volleyball tournament that has been dormant for 20 years.

title: Reid's debut rankings for the 2026 NFL draft: The top 50 players in the class
content: Jordan Reid unveils his initial rankings for the 2026 draft class, with the top 50 players, scouting reports and standouts at every position.

title: Last-minute pickups for Week 12: Target the Brissett-Wilson combo in Arizona
content: If bye weeks or injuries have you seeking lineup help, consider the Cardinals passing game and a sneaky defense.

title: The Playbook: Lineup locks, Shadow Reports for Week 12
content: An all-encompassing look at matchups to exploit or avoid and lineup locks in fantasy, as well as projected scores.

title: Wetzel: Is the NCAA infraction system now too speedy to be fair?
content: In an effort to speed up infractions rulings, the NCAA implemented a new system in 2023 for low-stakes cases.

title: Las Vegas Grand Prix: What to know ahead of the F1 weekend
content: With three races remaining of the 2025 season, Formula 1 heads to Las Vegas for the third edition of the glitzy grand prix. Find out all the timings, stats and information for the weekend.

title: Risers and fallers: November to remember for Daniss Jenkins, Kon Knueppel
content: Steve Alexander highlights fantasy basketball names trending upwards or downwards, with key takeaways for each.

title: How Mbappé's start at Real Madrid compares to greats like Ronaldo, Benzema
content: Kylian Mbappé has reached 75 games at Real Madrid in his best form since joining them. How does his start compare to some of the club's greatest strikers?

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United want Scott McTominay back
content: Manchester United are considering a move to bring Scott McTominay back to Old Trafford from Napoli. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Expert picks, best bets: How Tsarukyan can reenter title contention
content: MMA experts give their predictions for a UFC Fight Night from Doha, Qatar, headlined by lightweight contenders Arman Tsarukyan and Dan Hooker.

title: Bihar polls: Nearly 24,000 of over 2 lakh postal ballots rejected
content: Of the 5.02 crore total votes polled — EVM and postal ballot included — 4.93 crore were found valid and 9.34 lakh invalid

title: Supreme Court accepts Centre's definition of Aravali Hills, bans grant of fresh mining leases
content: SC directed the authorities to identify permissible areas for "mining and ecologically sensitive, conservation-critical and restoration priority areas within the Aravali landscape where mining shall be strictly prohibited or permitted only under exceptional and scientifically justified circumstances".

title: Maoists term encounters in Maredumilli Agency in ASR district fake
content: The police picked up the top leaders in Vijayawada on November 15 and shot them dead, the Central Committee of the banned outfit has alleged, and called for observance of black day on November 23

title: Free coaching for civil services exam aspirants in Eluru district
content: Candidates can submit applications with the required documents at BC Study Circle, Vennavallivaripeta, Dr. B.R. Ambedkar School, Eluru between November 17 and 25

title: DMK exerting pressure on BLOs during SIR in T.N., alleges Sudhakar Reddy
content: He says the exercise is being conducted by the Election Commission of India, an independent body, with the objective of cleaning the voter list

title: Speakers stress spiritual transformation and global harmony at Sri Sathya Sai World Conference
content: Fadnavis and Hari Babu underscore Baba’s message of love, service and unity as delegates from 45 countries gather for the centenary celebrations

title: Engage in sports to get relief from stress, police personnel told
content: Principal District and Sessions Judge B.S. Bharati says they have to handle stress on a day-to-day basis

title: Delay in payments will not be tolerated, warns Safai Karmachari Commission Chief
content: Workers say that they are being forced to carry out waste segregation illegally, and those who refuse are threatened with removal from duty

title: Cash for query: CBI opposes Mahua Moitra's plea against Lokpal order
content: The CBI contended that Ms. Moitra has no right to produce documents in the Lokpal's proceedings and she is only entitled to give comments and not even an oral hearing

title: KTR accuses CM of conspiring to give away high-value industrial land at cheap rates
content: The BRS working president says HILTP is the country’s largest land scam in the making and a blueprint to siphon off ₹5 lakh cr.

title: Tenant farmers cultivating temple lands seek  lease remission after cyclone damage
content: They appeal to the Endowments Department to allow two years of lease-free cultivation for those who have paid advance and a 50% reduction in lease for those who pay it after harvest

title: Cauvery delta farmers call for steps to thwart Karnataka’s move to build dam at Mekedatu
content: Farmers’ representatives urged the government to file a review petition before the Supreme Court and convene an all-party meeting to discuss the State’s future course of action on the issue

title: Central Water Commission team inspects progress of Polavaram project works
content: The delegation interacts with ground-level officials, seeks clarifications, and reviews engineering parameters to assess the quality and pace of construction

title: ‘Eko’ movie review: A solid mystery thriller in which animals play as big a part as humans
content: Dinjith Ayyathan’s ‘Eko’ dives into a world where animals and humans are more connected than you would think, and ends up as a solid mystery thriller thanks to its brilliant screenplay

title: Government committed to welfare of fisherfolk, says Andhra Pradesh Fisheries Minister Atchannaidu
content: Coastal development initiatives are being prioritised to ensure long-term economic stability for the fishing communities, he says

title: BLO ends life in Gujarat; family says death due to mental stress from SIR duty
content: A delegation of Gujarat Rajya Prathmik Shikshak Sangh, an association of government primary teachers, met election officials in Gandhinagar and made a representation about issues being faced by teachers working as BLOs.

title: Forest departments across India have no record of African grey parrot trade, reveal RTI responses
content: The parrot, which is listed under Appendix I of the Convention on International Trade in Endangered Species of Wild Flora and Fauna (CITES), requires special permits, including individual CITES registration and import certificates, for their trade in the domestic and international markets

title: Infiltrators and terror attacks reflect Home Ministry’s failure, Trinamool hits back at Amit Shah
content: The ire of Trinamool leaders was provoked by Mr. Shah’s speech on Friday, where he claimed that while some political parties are opposing the removal of infiltrators and the SIR process, the BJP-led  government will remove ‘each and every infiltrator from this country, one by one’

title: Udupi police arrest two UP men for sharing information on Indian Navy ships with Pakistan
content: Police suspect at least one of them of sharing sensitive classified information about naval ships for the last 18 months

title: Qualification criteria for electricity worker’s post in KSEB amended after 27 years
content: Updated qualifications require SSLC or equivalent for candidates while maintaining physical standards.

title: Ilaiyaraaja moves Madras High Court to protect his personality rights
content: Justice N. Senthilkumar injuncts TV channels, YouTube channels, social media influencers & others from using his name, title, and photos for commercial gain

title: Schools to report on compliance with mental health guidelines: Education minister
content: Following the alleged death of a class 10 student, Delhi Minister Ashish Sood will seek a detailed report on all the CBSE schools mental health guidelines

title: Did the SIR process decide Bihar’s election outcome? Data says ‘No’
content: The NDA’s advantages registered in the Lok Sabha elections in terms of vote share differences with the MGB remained mostly intact, despite a decrease in electorate numbers following the SIR

title: Protection of red sanders: National Biodiversity Board releases ₹39.84 crore to Andhra Pradesh
content: An amount of ₹87.68 crore was generated through regulated access to auctioned or seized red sanders wood by the Andhra Pradesh Forest Department towards benefit sharing

title: IAF’s Tejas fighter jet crashes at Dubai Air Show; pilot killed
content: Viral visuals on social media show the aircraft spiralling out of control just above the ground, igniting on impact, and sliding for a short distance before being engulfed in flames

title: The Hindu Lit for Life Dialogue Bengaluru highlights: Author Sanjaya Baru urges India to address net loss of human capital
content: Three compelling sessions came to an end with an impressive speakers discussing the issue of drugs such as Ozempic and Mounjaro and also the forces reshaping wealth creation in India in The Flight of Wealth

title: Labour laws passed by Parliament in 2020 come into effect
content: “New labour reforms are an important step towards a self-reliant India and will give new momentum to the goal of a developed India by 2047,” says Mansukh Mandaviya

title: Gajuwaka’s cement unit plan raises a ‘dust’
content: Gajuwaka residents lament that they have been experiencing dust and industrial pollution due to the presence of numerous small and medium industries in the area. The constant movement of trucks from the city to the industries in the Gajuwaka Assembly constituency is only adding to their problems. They fear that the proposed cement grinding unit will only worsen their health conditions and urge the government and the local representatives to stop the proposed plant, writes V. Kamalakara Rao

title: DMK-led alliance to protest Centre’s refusal to relax moisture-content limit for paddy procurement
content: Protests will be held on November 23 in Thanjavur and on November 24 in Tiruvarur, said a joint statement from the parties

title: Seven States enact laws on lines of Jan Vishwas Act to encourage business
content: Seven states, including Maharashtra and Madhya Pradesh, passed their own legislations or promulgated ordinances on the lines of the Jan Vishwas Act, making it the largest coordinated deregulation push undertaken at the State level to date

title: Supreme Court issues notice to EC as Kerala Government, political parties seek deferment of SIR
content: J. Kant remarks that political parties have now started coming to Supreme Court on the SIR issue. More parties contest the revision exercise and seek its deferment in Kerala

title: High costs, poor training deepen India’s stinging snakebite toll
content: New findings show that faster access to hospitals, improved anti-venoms, and health insurance are urgently needed to prevent avoidable deaths

title: Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah rules out leadership change; says he will present Budget
content: The Chief Minister said AICC President Mallikarjun Kharge will be visiting Bengaluru on Saturday, and he will meet him during the visit

title: T.N. Deputy CM Udhayanidhi Stalin calls Sanskrit a ‘dead language’; BJP hits back
content: Taking offence to his terminology, BJP leader Tamilisai Soundararajan said no one has the right to call any language dead, especially the one that is still used today in prayers and rituals across the country.

title: SIR for purification of voters’ list, Bihar win mandate against infiltrators, says Amit Shah
content: Amit Shah was addressing the BSF Diamond Jubilee (61st Raising Day) celebrations in Bhuj, in Gujarat’s Kutch district

title: Fancy being a traffic cop for a day in Bengaluru?
content: The Hindu reporter gets an opportunity to man one of Bengaluru’s busiest traffic junctions during the morning peak hour.

title: Projecting Round 1 of next year's draft
content: the 2026 draft is based on the standings through Week 11 . four teams currently have multiple first-round picks . the Rams ( from the Falcons ), the Browns (from the Jaguars ) and the Cowboys ( . from the Packers .

title: An open letter from Gen Z: Are we the problem or just the mirror no one wants to look into?
content: a group often labeled "chronically online," "entitled," or "too sensitive," it’s ironic how rarely we’re truly heard . one of the biggest misconceptions about us is that older generations still mistake what they see as a “trend,” an “aesthetic” or a set of quirks for the entirety of who we are .
